description: Via German, from Italian giro (“circulation”), from Latin gyrus (“circle”), from Ancient Greek γῦρος (gûros, “circle”).

entries.meaning: (in Europe) A transfer of funds between different account holders, carried out by the bank according to payer's written instructions.

verbs.description: giro (third-person singular simple present giros, present participle giroing, simple past and past participle giroed)

entries.meaning: To transfer funds between different account holders, carried out by the bank according to payer's written instructions.
